phaseBanner.text: This is a new service – your feedback will help us to improve it.

checkYourDetails.heading: We need to check your details
checkYourDetails.paragraph1: Your details will be checked against information held by another organisation.
checkYourDetails.paragraph2: This will help us protect you against online identity theft.

additionalDetails.summaryText: Who we check your details with
additionalDetails.text:
We’ll check your details with Experian (opens in new tab). This is because companies like Experian have access to information about interactions you’ve previously had with other organisations.

Read our privacy notice (opens in a new tab) if you’d like to know more about how your details will be used to prove your identity.

confirmDetails.heading: Confirm your details
confirmDetails.warning: Make sure your details are correct before you continue. You will not be able to change them later.

summaryList.key2: Year you started living at this address

confirmDetails.buttonText: I confirm my details are correct

enterAddress.heading: Enter your address
enterAddress.yearQuestion: When did you start living here?
enterAddress.yearQuestionHint: Enter the year you started living at this address, for example 2017

enterPassport.heading: Enter your details exactly as they appear on your UK passport
enterPassport.paragraph1: Your passport contains a lot of information that we can check to make sure that you are who you say you are.
enterPassport.paragraph2: We’ll check your details with the HM Passport Office to make sure your passport has not been cancelled or reported as lost or stolen.

passportNumberInput.hint: This is the 9 digit number in the top right hand corner of the photo page in your passport
passportNumberInput.label: Passport number

middleNameInput.label: Middle names
middleNameInput.hint: You do not have to fill this in if you do not have any middle names

findAddress.heading: Find your address
findAddress.inputHint: Enter the postcode of your current home address. This must be a UK postcode, for example SW1A 2AA.

chooseAddress.heading: Choose your address
chooseAddress.selectLabel: Choose your current home address from the list:
chooseAddress.noAddressLink: I cannot find my address in the list

proveIdentity.heading: Prove your identity
proveIdentity.paragraph2: We’ll ask for your current address and passport details.
proveIdentity.paragraph3: We’ll also ask you some security questions only you will know the answer to. You might find it easier to answer these questions if you have information about:
proveIdentity.paragraph4: You’ll be able to save your proof of identity to your GOV.UK account.
proveIdentity.listItem3: any credit cards, loans or morgages you may have

proveIdentityLoggedOut.heading: Prove your identity to continue
proveIdentityLoggedOut.paragraph: You need to prove your identity before you can [doThing].
proveIdentityLoggedOut.optionsLegend: How would you like to prove your identity?

optionOne.text: Prove your identity online using a GOV.UK account
optionOne.hint: You’ll be asked to create a GOV.UK account if you do not have one

optionTwo.text: Take your identity documents to be checked in person

proveIdentityLoggedOut.paragraph4: You’ll be able to save your proof of identity to your GOV.UK account.
proveIdentityLoggedOut.listItem3: any credit cards, loans or morgages you may have

save.heading: You’ve successfully proved your identity
save.paragraph: You can save your proof of identity to your GOV.UK account so you can skip these questions next time a service needs to check who you are.
save.buttonText: Save proof of identity to your GOV.UK account
save.linkText: Do not save proof of identity and continue to [service]

saved.heading: You’ve saved your proof of identity to your GOV.UK account
saved.paragraph1: This means you can skip the identity questions next time a service needs to check who you are.
saved.paragraph2: You can sign in to your GOV.UK account to see or delete your proof of identity at any time.

additionalDetails.summaryText: If you do not want to continue now
additionalDetails.text: You can [doThing] later. You’ll be asked to sign to to your GOV.UK account and use your saved proof of identity to continue.

answerSecurityQuestions.heading: Answer security questions
answerSecurityQuestions.paragraph1: We’ll ask you some security questions that only you should know the answers to. This will help us stop anyone else who might have your details from pretending to be you.
answerSecurityQuestions.paragraph2: The questions will be about things like your mobile phone contract, bank account, and any credit cards, loans or mortgages you have.
answerSecurityQuestions.paragraph3: We will not keep your answers.
answerSecurityQuestions.warning: Try to answer these questions as accurately as you can. You will not be able to change the answers if you make a mistake

questionOne.heading: How much did you borrow when you first took out your mortgage?
questionOne.hint: You can find this amount on your offer letter or mortgage agreement

questionTwo.heading: When did you take out your mobile phone contract?
questionTwo.hint: Think about when you took out your personal mobile phone contract instead of your work phone, if you have one.

questionThree.heading: When did you open your current account?
questionThree.hint: Think about your current account only. This does not include any joint, business or savings accounts you might have.

questionFour.heading: How much of your loan do you pay back every month?
questionFour.hint: Think about the amount you agreed to pay back every month on a personal loan. This does not include hire purchase agreements, second mortgages, home credit loans or student loans. You can find this amount on your loan agreement.

useSavedIdentity.heading: Use your saved proof of identity to continue
useSavedIdentity.paragraph1: You need to prove your identity before you [doThing].
useSavedIdentity.paragraph2: Your GOV.UK account will check your saved proof of identity to confirm it’s really you.

activity.title: Account activity
activity.contactUs: If you see something you do not recognise, contact us.

home.title: Your GOV.UK account
home.servicesHeading: Services you’ve used with your GOV.UK account
home.IdServicesHeading: Services that have checked your identity
home.IdServicesParagraph: You’ve used your GOV.UK account to prove your identity to the following services:

aboutAccounts.heading: About GOV.UK accounts
aboutAccounts.paragraph1: GOV.UK accounts are new. At the moment you can only use your GOV.UK account with a few services.
aboutAccounts.paragraph2: GOV.UK accounts are currently separate from other government accounts (for example Government Gateway or Universal Credit).
aboutAccounts.paragraph3: In the future, you’ll be able to use your GOV.UK account to sign in to most services on GOV.UK.

settings.title: GOV.UK account settings

yourProofOfId.heading: Your proof of identity
yourProofOfId.link: View your saved proof of identity
yourProofOfId.info: You’ve saved your proof of identity to your account. Your account will check it each time a service needs to confirm who you are.

yourAccountActivity.heading: View your account activity
yourAccountActivity.info: See when you’ve signed in and how your account has used your saved information.

deleteAccount.heading: Delete your GOV.UK account
deleteAccount.info: This will permanently delete your GOV.UK account. You’ll no longer be able to sign in to the services you’ve used with your account.

settings.deletedProofOfIdSuccess: You’ve deleted your proof of identity

yourProofOfId.title: Your proof of identity
yourProofOfId.paragraph1: Your GOV.UK account proves your identity with information you’ve provided.
yourProofOfId.paragraph2: Your account checks this information to prove your identity every time you use a service that requires it.
yourProofOfId.summaryListTitle: Information you’ve provided to prove your identity
yourProofOfId.deleteInformationLink: Delete this information from your account

deleteProofOfId.title: Delete the information you use to prove your identity
deleteProofOfId.paragraph1: Confirm you want to permanently delete the information your GOV.UK account uses to prove your identity. This will not delete your account.
deleteProofOfId.paragraph2: You will need to go through the process of proving your identity next time you use a service that requires it.
